main event: Two circular objects were observed in the sky over Kingston, Pennsylvania on 22 August 1957.
interesting points: The first object was twice the size of a basketball and white, while the second was twice the size of a grapefruit and orange., The sighting lasted for 1 hour and 15 minutes., The objects disappeared over the horizon in a westerly direction., The observer noted that there were no other objects in the sky during the sighting., The results suggest that they were probably astronomical bodies, specifically Venus and Jupiter.
sighted object: two circular objects in the sky
witness description: a family, with at least one observer being a sober Navy seaman
